net.uniform.api

Interface FormValidator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DateRangeValidator

    public interface FormValidator

    A form validator is like an element validator (Validator), but is applied to the whole form. It's useful for applying validation logic that is dependent on the values of more than one element.

    A set of basic form validators are included in Uniform in the package net.uniform.html.formvalidators

    Author:
    Eduardo Ramos

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean breakChainOnError()
      Indicates if this validator returning any error should prevent next form validators from being called.
      List<String> getValidationErrors(Form form, Map<String,List<String>> formData)
      Returns the validation errors for the form, if any.

    • Method Detail

      • getValidationErrors

        List<String> getValidationErrors(Form form,
                                 Map<String,List<String>> formData)
        Returns the validation errors for the form, if any.
        Parameters:
        form - Form
        formData - Current form data as multi-value strings
        Returns:
        List of errors (may be empty) or null

      • breakChainOnError

        boolean breakChainOnError()
        Indicates if this validator returning any error should prevent next form validators from being called.
        Returns:
        True to stop next form validators on error, false otherwise
